data.title: Good Value
data.text: The house Merlot was surprisingly good.  We had the soup and salad bar.  Very good with 6 varieties of soup.

data.title: Great service and food
data.text: Passing through for lunch, was immediately greeted by the hostess who thanked me for choosing Jakers. I sat at the bar, was thanked again by the bartender and given great food and service. Good value, quick food delivery and a great experience. Jakers is one of my favorite stops.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Happy that Jakers is a favorite stop for you Margaret. Thank you for the wonderful review and we hope to see you next time you are passing through!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Food coma!!!
data.text: Excellent service! Excellent food! 2 of the 4 had ribeye......... delicious. Sue was our server and she was a pleasure to deal with. Everyone raves about the scones. They are wonderful. Only complaint is that the entree came when we were still eating our soups/salads. Great atmosphere.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We hope that you made it home before your food coma set in, Mike! Thank you for the wonderful review - happy that you enjoyed the service and our food. We hope to serve you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Food, Awesome Soups, Excellent Service
data.text:
Jakers restaurant is downtown, but not too far from the highway. They have a wonderful selection of American fare. The Scones served throughout the meal are outstanding and better than in Scotland! The meatloaf and the blue cheese bacon burger are excellent. The Lobster Bisque was especially tasty, with generous portions of lobster meat. The all-you-can-eat soup and salad bar is a meal in itself. The bar includes several homemade soups (lobster bisque, potato, tortilla, etc.), shrimp, ham, chicken, and a host of other salads. To top it off, have the mud pie. It consists of three flavors of ice cream and an incredible crust, which three of us worked hard to finish. (Plus the price is very reasonable.) Service is fast, friendly, and very attentive without being pushy.

The restaurant has a full bar and casino and fills up early. I will go back the next time I am in Great Falls.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Glad to hear you will be joining us next time you're in Great Falls, MontanaCraig! We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed our food and our customer service - we appreciate the stellar review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: LOVED IT ... don't miss out
data.text:
This place was fantastic!  I loved the ambience in the lounge and our spunky, humorous Waite person "Colleen"

Let's just say the warm scones with honey butter were out of this world delicious!

My apple caramel martini's were to die for and the Creme Brûlée is still making my mouth water after several days.

The baked potatoes have olive oil with sea salt and cracked black pepper which makes for an even more fab potato experience.

The scallops were a tiny over done but in cheesy, buttery garlic, so I have no complaints there.

My husband had the 14oz Rib steak cooked to rare perfection!  Nicely marbled.  However they don't add spices, so if you like your steak with some pizazz, better request it.

I would go back to a JAKERS restaurant at any future opportunity.

Hubby ordered Earthquake Zinfandel and a JAKERS Cab Sav wine ... he loved both of them but especially the JAKERS Cab Sav.

H.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hellen, thank you for the fantastic review - we are happy that you are thinking of our Creme Brûlée even after several days (trust us, the same happens to our staff too). Hope you are able to join us again soon, we promise to keep the ambience spunky!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Surprisingly Good
data.text: I was all set for a Montana streak.  This was the place to go just a few blocks from my motel.  The Rib Eye appealed to me as di the evening's offering of clam chowder.  I added in some calamari appetizers all washed down with a local IPA.  The steak was done much to my order and liking.  The calamari were a disappointment, but the IPA was excellent.  The steak for its size although tasty was a bit "spendy."  Also, I did feel the server lacked attentiveness and seemed to take unnecessary delays in responding to requests.  It was a good steak, though.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your review and are happy that you enjoyed your steak! Jakers apologizes that the calamari was not more to your liking. Not sure where you were visiting Montana from, but we hope to see you next time you are here!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Atomsphere
data.text: We had excellent service at the restaurant.  The spinach salad was excellent.  The prime rib was marginal. Recommend trying another cut of meat.

data.title: Good food
data.text: The best soup and salad bar ever. A lobster bisque that will make you want to come back (large chunks of lobster), as well as 3-4 other soups out front.  If you ask, they will bring you out tomato and or French onion soup from the back. The salad bar is also really good, and I usually go back afterwards and get the berries and fruit for desert. The wait staff will give you a nice cold plate for the fruit. You also get warm rolls. All of this for one price, and definitely worth it. You can add this to a meal (the rest of their food is good too), but I usually find the soup/salad bar enough.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review Della. We hope to serve you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dinner at Jakers
data.text: Wonderful food. A little pricey but worth it as the give you a huge serving. Delicious bread and comfortable atmosphere.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review Anita. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Poor Service
data.text: We came in with a party of 12 people. Everyone received their meals at the same time except for me, because the kitchen had made a mistake. I did not receive my dinner until it was time to leave, so I told them to box it up and I would take it with me.  The waitress was not apologetic at all, and when I suggested that this meal should come at no charge, she refused.  We spent between $400 and $500 that evening, plus the required tip.  You would think they would want to make it right and would want us to return.  We will never patronize Jakers again, nor recommend them (I work in a tourism related business).

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Jay,
 
Thank you for your honest review. I apologize we did not live up to Jakers standards when you dined with us last. I wish this would have been brought to management attention that night so we could have had you taken care of right away. I would like to personally rectify this and try to earn your business back. Could you please email me directly at doug@jakers.com so we can discuss this further and so I can get a gift card sent to you asap to at least make up for the meal that should have been taken care of then? We appreciate your business. Thanks again and I look forward to hearing from you soon.
 
Sincerely,
Doug Collier
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice atmosphere that lives off tourists.
data.text: Location, Location, Location.  Food is typical higher end chain fare.  Nothing bad or nothing great.  Surrounded by Hotels so get's a lot of tourist trade. Not really a locals place, although everyone goes there occasionally. Nice bar & good place for appetizers. A pleasant experience, but not fine dining.

data.title: Great food
data.text: I had the fish (cod) tacos for dinner. They were the best fish tacos I've  every eaten. Fish was moist, excellent seasoning and the Chipotle dressing added a nice kick. My friend had the salmon and was also very impressed. Well worth another trip back for dinner.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review Carra. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Just ok
data.text: Had good reviews but was a bit disappointed, soups were ok bit salty, small salad bar selection.  Asked for my burger well done but still had lots of blood running out. Staff were friendly that was best part of our experience.  Probably will not go back.

data.title: I'm full. And happy.
data.text: We went to eat at the salad/soup bar, which was excellent!  I ended up getting the spinach artichoke dip appetizer (yum), a steak and baked potato (more yum) and an avocado crab salad (yum again). My drink was good, my food excellent and tasty (although I will say I ordered my steak Med rare and I believe it was medium).  Everything was good, made on site, and compared to big city standards very reasonable.  I'd come back!!

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Better place to eat in Great Falls
data.text: Very delicious food, the appetizers were amazing. Full bar of beers, shots and mixed drink. A very spread out floor plan which is nice because you don't feel packed in. It is more expensive but way better than the other places that are the same price in town.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review. We hope to serve you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food and good value
data.text: This restaurant was recommended by the hotel and we really lucked out. The steak was extremely good and if we were here for longer, we would go there again. The service was excellent too. Good price for such good steak and well cooked veg.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Always Great
data.text: Service and food is always wonderful. They have the best gluten free bun I've had at a restaurant. My favorite menu item is the Hickory Burger, sometimes they forget the bacon but are always willing to give extra bacon to compensate.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review. We hope to serve you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good steak, great salad bar
data.text: Had the filet, it was good but the lobster bisque was fantastic. Salad and soup bar is half price with entree and worth every cent. Normal $15 and it would still be a good price.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review Jonathan. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food, reasonable prices
data.text: I had several meals here while working in Great Falls - the food was quite good, especially the steaks.  The rolls are the best!  I would definitely eat here again.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review Geof. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent restaurant
data.text: A very good restaurant and bar. The food is of high quality as is the service and there is a good selection of wines, beers and cocktails at fair prices. The seafood is excellent and fresh. Well worth a visit.

owner_response.author: Doug C, General Manager at Jakers Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review Doug. We hope to serve you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
